column4: Um, ok thats bad. The liveCD just froze, and I just ran Check CD on it
I'm pretty sure my hardware is good...
When I hit numlock, I was goint to try sudo modprobe rt2500pci and when I hit numblock too type 2500 it seemed to crash
I've not touched this computer since oh, last summer
when I tired to get linux working on it
which os live-cd are you running?
I think the lastest Ubuntu relase
hangs are usually hardware related. Maybe you should run a memtest overnight?
I guess, but I used this computer constanly till I got my laptop without trouble so unless its broken down while sitting unplugged
9.04 is fussier than other releases. Another options is try again with 8.04.2
I'll try that if installing it doesn't work
